main_definition: Cheers is an expression used to signify good wishes, celebration or a toast during drinking events.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A common salutation when raising a glass in social settings to wish others well
meanings_and_examples.example: As we all clink our glasses and say 'cheers' before starting the meal.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as an informal way of saying 'thank you' or showing appreciation
meanings_and_examples.example: After receiving help from a friend, I raised my glass to them and said 'cheers'. It was their kindness that made this day special.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as an expression of good wishes when someone has achieved something significant
meanings_and_examples.example: At the end of her graduation ceremony, everyone stood up, raised their glasses and said 'cheers' to celebrate her success.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A toast made at a social gathering or event, often accompanied by clinking glasses
meanings_and_examples.example: The host invited us all to raise our glasses in a unified cheers as we celebrated his promotion.
